section.title: Overview
section.para: The sipcapture module stores incoming/outgoing SIP messages in database.

Kamailio can capture SIP messages in three modes
IPIP encapsulation. (ETHHDR+IPHDR+IPHDR+UDPHDR).
Monitoring/mirroring port.
Homer encapsulation protocol mode (HEP v1, v2, v3).
The capturing can be turned on/off using mi or rpc commands. Example:
&ctltool; fifo sip_capture on
&ctltool; fifo sip_capture off

section.title: &kamailio; Modules
section.para:
The following modules must be loaded before this module:
database module - mysql, postrgress, dbtext, unixodbc...

section.title: External Libraries or Applications
section.para:
The following libraries or applications must be installed before running &kamailio; with this module loaded:
None.

section.title: db_url (str)
section.para: Database URL.

section.title: table_name (str)
section.para: Name of the table's name used to store the SIP messages. Can contain multiple tables, separated by "|".

section.title: mt_mode (str)
section.para: Name of the mode used for storing data in multiple tables. Modes can be "rand" (random), "round_robin" (use a round_robin algorithm) or "hash" (use hashing to determine the table to store). These modes are only triggered if there is more than one table specified in table_name parameter, separated by "|".

section.title: hash_source (str)
section.para: The field of the SIP message used for hashing, when mt_mode is set to "hash". The value can be "call_id", "to_user" or "from_user".

section.title: db_insert_mode (integer)
section.para: If set to 1, use INSERT DELAYED to store sip message into capture table when the DB driver has support for it. If no INSERT DELAYED support is offered by DB driver, then standard INSERT is used.
Default value is 0 (no INSERT DELAYED).

section.title: capture_on (integer)
section.para: Parameter to enable/disable capture globaly (on(1)/off(0))

section.title: capture_mode (integer)
section.para: This parameter can be used for defining a capture mode which can be used in the sip_capture calls as a parameter. A capture mode has a name and some parameters. It must be defined in the format: name=>param1=val1;param2=val2;... The parameters are db_url, table_name, mt_mode and hash_source (optional). Multiple capture modes can be defined by using this parameter multiple times. After this, the capture modes can be used like: sip_capture ("", "CAPTURE_MODE");

section.title: hep_capture_on (integer)
section.para: Parameter to enable/disable capture of HEP (on(1)/off(0))

section.title: raw_ipip_capture_on (integer)
section.para: Parameter to enable/disable IPIP capturing (on(1)/off(0))

section.title: raw_moni_capture_on (integer)
section.para: Parameter to enable/disable monitoring/mirroring port capturing (on(1)/off(0)) Only one mode on raw socket can be enabled! Monitoring port capturing currently supported only on Linux.

section.title: raw_socket_listen (string)
section.para:
Parameter indicate an listen IP address of RAW socket for IPIP capturing. You can also define a port/portrange for IPIP/Mirroring mode, to capture SIP messages in specific ports:
"10.0.0.1:5060" - the source/destination port of the SIP message must be equal 5060
"10.0.0.1:5060-5090" - the source/destination port of the SIP message must be equal or be between 5060 and 5090.
The port/portrange must be defined if you are planning to use mirroring capture! In this case, the part with IP address will be ignored, but to make parser happy, use i.e. 10.0.0.0

section.title: raw_interface (string)
section.para: Name of the interface to bind on the raw socket.

section.title: raw_sock_children (integer)
section.para: Parameter define how many children that must be created to listen the raw socket.

section.title: promiscuous_on (integer)
section.para: Parameter to enable/disable promiscuous mode on the raw socket. Linux only.

section.title: raw_moni_bpf_on (integer)
section.para: Activate Linux Socket Filter (LSF based on BPF) on the mirroring interface. The structure is defined in linux/filter.h. The default LSF accept a port/portrange from the raw_socket_listen param. Currently LSF supported only on Linux.

section.title: capture_node (str)
section.para: Name of the capture node.

section.title: insert_retries (integer)
section.para: The number of times Kamailio should retry to write to the Homer database in case the first attempt failed. The retry is also limited timewise by the insert_retry_timeout parameter. Values allowed range from 0 to 500.

section.title: insert_retry_timeout (integer)
section.para: The time limit in seconds Kamailio retries to write to the Homer database in case the first attempt failed. This parameter is only used together with the insert_retries parameter. Values allowed range from 0 to 300.

section.title: Database setup
section.para: Before running &kamailio; with the sipcapture module, you have to setup the database tables where the module will store the data. For that, if the table were not created by the installation script or you choose to install everything by yourself you can use the sipcapture_create.sql, SQL script in the sql folder of sipcapture module as template. You can also find the complete database documentation on the project webpage, &kamailiodbdocslink;.

itemizedlist.listitem: 1. Only one capturing mode on RAW socket is supported: IPIP or monitoring/mirroring port. Don't activate both at the same time.
2. By default MySQL doesn't support INSERT DELAYED for partitioning table. You can patch MySQL (http://bugs.mysql.com/bug.php?id=50393)
3. Mirroring port capturing works only on Linux.
